bib.title: Training set selection using entropy based distance
bib.author: Kajdanowicz, Tomasz and Plamowski, Slawomir and Kazienko, Przemyslaw
bib.abstract: Distance measures, especially between probability density functions, are essential in solving machine learning problems. Among classification and clustering, data reduction and selection are some of them. In the paper a new distance measure for comparing and selecting training datasets is described. The distance between two datasets is based on variance of entropy in groups obtained by clustering joint datasets. The proposed approach is examined in dataset selection during prediction of debt portfolio value. Finally, basic
bib.booktitle: 2011 IEEE Jordan Conference on Applied Electrical Engineering and Computing Technologies (AEECT)
